It feels like, for whatever reason, Riot is trying to force things down the games throat as hard as possible. The marksmen update is all well and good, as a lot of ADCs played exactly the same and were generally uninteresting. However (and they did this with the juggernaut update as well), I see no reason for Riot to just up and start shifting the entire meta of the game towards prioritizing these champions.

Its horrendously obvious with the current state of the game that they are trying to shove AP champions into a sub-optimal position in the meta by increasing the cost of all their items as well as providing a mere 2 keystone masteries that can even be considered as viable on mages. But even worse is the far greater variety and item optimization that AD champions on the whole have over AP champions in every role.

It should never be easier for an ADC to max out their CDR over a mage honestly, but that's what its like currently on live.

riot said that AP was a better stat than AD, that's why they increased the cost of AP items, just if you wanted to know their explination

That makes no sense though.  AD is far more reliable damage, and it can be used to take all objectives much faster, even with the recent buff to AP-scaling damage to towers.  

Yes,  some AP-based abilities have higher scalings than their AD-based counterparts, they also tend to have longer cooldowns, higher mana costs, and are typically less reliable.  

Additionally, if you spell-shield/counter/dodge a mage's abilities, you're typically safe.  If you shield an AD-user's abilities, you still need to watch out for their (comparatively) strong auto-attacks.  

There are some outliers to what I've said, for example Lee Sin's high scalings, Ekko's high auto-attacks, and Orianna's low cooldowns, but overall the generalizations are accurate.

Actually, he's got a point.  Without W and the R passive, Tahm has decent mobility on his ultimate, but he's otherwise a weaker Taric.  He has ranged hard CC (similar to Taric's stun) and he's really tanky with E.  That's not really enough for a support though.

I noticed that somewhere along the line, pure-mechanics was no longer a part of the player skill base. From having skills that did this and you have to adapt and learn to play the character. Move "situational" bandaids was made. Alot of skills are completly situational now, and not a pure mechanic.

My favorite champ, Teemo is a bright example for me on this point. He has a pretty pure set of skills. A Q with blind and quiet a powerful %AP. A W with passive and active speed-boost. An E with a well put poison addon that makes playing different weapons an option. This is solid, and also very versatile. And then his shrooms, that make him tactically superior if you take the time to learn them.

All in all, so many champs are a clusterfuck, not relating to the character they are. And also, Riot was is going on with all these useless ultis? Really...What is going on here?
